meanings.definition: A unit of electric charge equal to the quantity of electricity transferred by a current of one ampere in one second.
meanings.sent1: She measured the electricity in coulometers to determine the total charge.
meanings.sent2: The coulometers displayed the amount of electric charge accurately.
meanings.sent3: The coulometers at the science fair were buzzing with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The coulometers danced with energy as the experiment progressed.
meanings.sent5: The bright display showed the coulometers filling up rapidly.

meanings.definition: An instrument for measuring electric charge in coulombs.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used the coulometers to check the electric charge in the circuit.
meanings.sent2: The coulometers on the lab bench were essential for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous student tried to play a tune on the coulometers.
meanings.sent4: The coulometers hummed softly, revealing the charge in the wires.
meanings.sent5: The precise readings from the coulometers helped in analyzing the charge distribution.
